page.title: 16News item,23.5.85
page.content: {EAST ANGLIAN DAILY TIMES} "Jail-breaking Jimmy Simmond could not believe his luck when a car he stopped offered him a lift....but his joy was short-lived for he was driven straight back to prison.Luckless Simmond,23,had hitched a lift in a police car full of plain-clothes detectives. He had escaped from Highpoint Prison at 8.30p.m.on Tuesday and was recaptured within the hour.He was picked up byC.I.D. officers at a nearby pub,The Royal Oak at Little Bradley where he was seeking a lift from customers. Mrs.Dorothy Monk,wife of the landlord,Ronald,said they were suspicious of Simmond when he started asking people in the pub for a lift (continued)
